timeline.event: Gauhar Jan (born Angelina Yeoward), the first female playback singer, records a song on 78rpm released by the Gramophone company of India.
Saraswatibai Phalke, the first female editor, is also a creative collaborator to her husband, Dadasaheb Phalke, starting from the first Indian feature film, 'Raja Harishchandra'.
Durgabai Kamat, the first actress of Indian cinema, appears in Dadasaheb Phalke's 'Mohini Bhasmasur'.
Kamlabai Kamat, the first child actress of Indian cinema, appears in Dadasaheb Phalke's 'Mohini Bhasmasur' alongside her mother, Durgabai Kamat.
Fatma Begum, the first female producer, director, and writer of Indian cinema, releases her debut film 'Bulbul-e-Paristan'.
Fatma Begum, the first female director of Indian cinema, releases her last film 'Goddess of Luck'.
Devika Rani, widely known as the first lady of Indian cinema, assists in costume design and art direction for Himanshu Rai's 'A Throw of Dice'.
Fearless Nadia, the first female stuntwoman of Indian cinema, debuts in 'Hunterwali'.
Saraswati Devi (real name Khorshed Minocher Homji) composes music for 'Jawani ki Hawa' and ties for the position of the first female music director of Indian cinema.
Jaddan Bai composes the music for and acts in 'Talashe Haq'.
Saroj Mohini Nayyar, India's first female lyricist, pens 'Preetam Aan Milo'.
Parvati Nayar Menon, the first woman student at FTII, completes her course in Screenplay Writing & Elements of Direction.
Ava Das, Pratima Naik, Rehana Sultan, Sudha Rani Sharma, and Urvashi Datta are the first five women to graduate in Acting from FTII.
Parvati Nayar Menon completes her course in Advanced Direction.
Bani Datta completes her course in Screenplay Writing & Elements of Direction.
Naimeth Unnisa Suneri and Sabha Fazil graduate in Acting from FTII.
Bani Datta completes her course in Advanced Direction.
Asha K Chandra and Ulka Sonawane graduate in Acting from FTII.
Saroj Khan choreographs her first song for 'Geeta Mera Naam'.
Bhanu Athaiya wins India's first Oscar for her work as a costume designer for 'Gandhi'.
BR Vijayalakshmi becomes Asia's first female cinematographer, making her debut as the Director of Photography for the popular Tamil film 'Chinna Veedu'.
